us so with govcloud it's fundamentally an isolated region on our AWS Cloud that
we built specifically for customers and organizations and solutions providers
that have more stringent requirements in terms of regulations or security requirements or compliance requirements

in the state of Oregon uh and it is a 2az region so it's a two availability zone region that allows you to to
architect workloads in a high availability fashion but while it's fundamentally
just a region on our platform in order for us to address the requirements that we have to from a public sector
perspective we did have to design the region slightly differently to allow us to to address those requirements to
allow our customers to use cloud in a compliant Manner and there's some fundamental uniqueness to govcloud that
I'll cover here in a second first the region is both physically and logically isolated from
all other regions on our platform to include the other US regions and that means data isolation machine isolation
and network isolation we have separate services in govcloud with specific endpoints to the govcloud region and
that physical and logical isolation and creates a partitioned aspect of the AWS Cloud to allow customers to run those
more sensitive workloads in the region along those isolation uh
characteristics as well we focused on providing an environment that had unique access controls right so once customers
request access to govcloud after they're approved for access to govcloud we give customers a unique set of credentials
that only work in govcloud so we wanted to go A Step Beyond just physically and logically isolating in the region we
wanted to lock down access to ensure customers only had credentials that would work in govcloud for their more
sensitive workloads to avoid situations where they may you know log into the
traditional AWS uh Management console and use a another region on the platform and mistakenly think they're they're
operating in a region that's more compliant for their their regulated workloads so all customers all Partners
all users that are approved for access to govcloud get a unique set of credentials that only work in the
govcloud region and then finally a dedicated ads Management console so we we pulled the
isolation thread a bit further and decided to build a dedicated UI graphical user interface that only
focuses and and talks directly to the govcloud region so this Management console works like the traditional AWS
Management console with the exception that it only points to the govcloud region it only shows you services and
features and capabilities in govcloud and it only allows you to to interact with the resources that you have
deployed in the govcloud region so when we talk about isolation it's fundamentally about those three aspects
physical and logical isolation unique set of credentials and a dedicated Management console to allow customers
and users to interact with their regulated workloads we also had to think about how

um characteristics that specifically limit access to itar data so internally
for AWS we only operate govcloud with AWS Personnel that are US citizens on us

to our govcloud team and even to our support team if if applicable right so
we make the guarantee to our customers that internally govcloud is only operated with US citizens on us soil and

citizens posture in gocloud gocloud is often referred to as
our community Cloud as well and that's fundamentally because we control who gets access to govcloud we'll talk about

uh in the govcloud region we took a similar approach with DOD so DOD has a
